newsitem.title: BRAZIL: Brazil posts $124 mln trade deficit in July 1-6.
newsitem.headline: Brazil posts $124 mln trade deficit in July 1-6.

text.p: Brazil posted a $124 million trade deficit in the first week of July, with exports totalling $921 million and imports $1.045 billion, the Industry and Commerce Ministry said in a statement.
In terms of daily averages, exports between July 1-6 were $230.1 million, while imports were $261.3 million, the ministry said in a statement.
In June, Brazil posted a trade deficit of $466 million taking the shortfall for the first six months of the year to more than $4.7 billion.
